Interface ICategoryRepository

Namespace
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.Interfaces.Repositories
Assembly
NeonSuit.RSSReader.Core.dll

Repository interface for managing Category entities, which group RSS feeds into logical folders or collections with support for custom ordering, colors, and hierarchy.

public interface ICategoryRepository : IRepository<Category>
Inherited Members
IRepository<Category>.GetAllAsync(CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.GetByIdAsync(int, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.GetWhereAsync(Expression<Func<Category, bool>>, CancellationToken)

IRepository<Category>.CountWhereAsync(Expression<Func<Category, bool>>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.InsertAsync(Category, CancellationToken)

IRepository<Category>.DeleteByIdAsync(int, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.InsertOrUpdateAsync(Category, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.InsertAllAsync(IEnumerable<Category>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.UpdateAllAsync(IEnumerable<Category>, CancellationToken)
IRepository<Category>.DeleteAllAsync(CancellationToken)

Remarks

Categories serve as the primary organizational structure for feeds in the RSS reader. They enable users to group related feeds (e.g., "News", "Technology", "Work", "Personal") and provide visual customization (colors, icons) and sorting.

Key responsibilities and behavioral expectations:

  • CRUD operations for categories with validation (unique names, non-empty names)
  • Ordering and reordering support via SortOrder field (user-draggable lists)
  • Unread article count aggregation per category (for badges in feed list/category view)
  • Automatic sort order assignment on creation
  • Change tracking management (detach, clear tracker) for bulk or performance scenarios

Business rules:

  • Category names must be unique (case-insensitive in most implementations)
  • Deleting a category does **not** delete feeds — feeds become uncategorized (CategoryId = null)
  • SortOrder is 0-based or 1-based (implementation-dependent); gaps are allowed
  • Unread counts include only articles where ArticleStatus = Unread and Feed.CategoryId matches
  • Reorder operations should be atomic (transactional) to prevent inconsistent ordering

Performance considerations:

  • GetUnreadCountsByCategoryAsync uses optimized JOIN + GROUP BY (no full entity loading)
  • ReorderAsync should use batch UPDATE or CASE WHEN for efficiency
  • Avoid loading full Category objects when only ID/count is needed

Usage scenarios:

  • Sidebar/category tree rendering with unread badges
  • Drag-and-drop reordering in settings
  • New category creation during feed subscription
  • Bulk feed import → auto-create categories if needed

Methods

ClearChangeTracker()

Clears the entire Entity Framework change tracker.

void ClearChangeTracker()

Remarks

Extreme caution advised: only use in bulk import/sync scenarios.

CreateWithOrderAsync(string, string?, string?, CancellationToken)

Creates a new category with automatically assigned next SortOrder.

Task<Category> CreateWithOrderAsync(string name, string? color = null, string? description = null, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

name string

Required category name (must be unique).

color string

Optional hex color code (e.g., "#FF5733").

description string

Optional description or notes.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<Category>

The newly created and persisted Category entity.

DeleteAsync(int, CancellationToken)

Deletes a category by ID.

Task<int> DeleteAsync(int id, CancellationToken cancellationToken = default)

Parameters

id int

The ID of the category to delete.

cancellationToken CancellationToken

Cancellation token.

Returns

Task<int>

Number of rows affected (1 on success).

Remarks

Does not delete associated feeds — sets Feed.CategoryId = null.
